description:
Learn how to craft a simple miniature fence / prison dungeon scatter terrain for D&D in this tabletop terrain tutorial. If you liked this one, go check out more D&D Terrain Tutorials on my channel.
↓↓ Check out the Super Interesting Links↓↓

➢Support the Channel on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/bardscraft 
➢or donate Paint Funds: https://www.paypal.me/lsjoman
➢Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/bardscraft/
Thank you, any support is significant, as it allows me to craft more Terrain & Minis, and make simple tutorials of the process.

      -------------------------------------------------------------------------------

PLAYLISTS TO WATCH
➢All my Monster Miniatures: https://tinyurl.com/y22ck2cv 
➢All my Terrain for D&D: https://tinyurl.com/yyco9kkr 
➢Dragons!: https://tinyurl.com/yyeq7qed
➢Simple Castle Terrain: https://tinyurl.com/y4x34ldc
➢Crafting Guides & Experiments: https://tinyurl.com/y6zxxc2f

          -------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ESSENTIAL ITEMS (any purchases following these link support the channel, thanks!)
➢5th Edition Monster Manual: https://amzn.to/2p5WHOn
➢7$ Kitchen "Crafting" Knife: https://amzn.to/2pK2A3T
➢PVA-Glue: https://amzn.to/2Wcesrp
➢Sturdy Utility Knife + Blades: https://amzn.to/2oceKCb
➢Handheld Foam Cutter: https://amzn.to/2WhDHbO
Disclaimer: I have not used the specific products, but I checked them and simply assume that they will do. I Hope this helps you get started!

          -------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Join the Bard's Craft Discord server where we shall share and discuss Tabletop Crafting!
➢Bard's Craft Nerd Chat: https://discord.gg/n5AfW36


Here are some tips for crafting this piece of cheap terrain: 
0:40 GLUING THE FENCE - It's easier to hold the sticks in place by sticking them into some foam, they easily move while working

1:13 STONE PILLARS - If you play on uneven terrain, adding bases to the stone pillars could be great for balance

1:43 GLUING THE FENCE TO THE STONES - 

2:16 CRAFTING THE GATE - If you don't need a functional gate that can be opened, a larger gate built between larger stone pillars would probably look better.

3:19 STONE BASE PAINT - Mixing in some brown and green should make it look more natural 

4:03 STONE BROWN PAINT - Also works great with grey

4:27 STONE GREY HIGHLIGHT -

4:53 PAINTING THE FENCE - Probably better to use actual iron metallic paints

5:50 PROJECT SHOWCASE - Subscribe & Like if you enjoyed this. Have you made anything similar, or do you have any good ideas? Share in the Comments!
title: Miniature Fence / Dungeon Scatter Terrain for D&D (Tabletop Terrain Tutorial)
